required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of BV With Donaxyl and a Molecular Test of Cure
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Bacterial Vaginosis With Dequalinium Chloride Vaginal Tablets and a Test of Cure Using a New Molecular Diagnostic Test for the Diagnosis of Bacterial Vaginosis

brief_summary.textblock: . Treatment with dequalinium chloride vaginal tablets for 6 days had a cure rate lower than expected; only 37% of patients were considered cured one month after treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: This is the first study to utilize a molecular diagnostic test as a test of cure for bacterial vaginosis. The Nugent score is a reliable method for diagnosing bacterial vaginosis, but similar to traditional clinical diagnostic methods, it is not equally reliable when utilized as a test of cure. This study demonstrated that molecular diagnostic testing can be used as a test of cure and this is the first molecular test that can do that. Treatment with dequalinium chloride vaginal tablets for 6 days had a cure rate lower than expected; only 37% of patients were considered cured one month after treatment.

primary_outcome.description: how many that are cured of BV after 1 month

secondary_outcome.measure: Diagnosis of BV using molecular test
secondary_outcome.description: the Kappa index Hay/ison diagnosis and the molecular test

intervention.description: treatment of BV with dequalinium chloride vaginal tablets

study_pop.textblock: local maternity and youth clinics in Skaraborg county

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
BV
Exclusion Criteria:
No other infection (Gc, clhlamydia, trihomonas)

clinical_study.keyword: Bacterial vaginosis, polymerase chain reaction, molecular diagnostic
